participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.message:
Any thoughts on pushing the release back by 2-3 days? There’s been some disruption with all the health news, and I know we’re doing a big March push out that we want to be stable.

Thoughts on doing that versus having a bunch of cherry picks come in?

We’ve been debating this very question as a product team, and given the disruption to schedule and morale, it would be wise for us to consider it. I’d like customer success folks to chime in here for ramifications on their end.
cc: @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire @paul
yeah, i think we can probably swing this but will validate
2-3 days shouldn’t be an issue at all
having a bunch of cherry picks come in would be much more disruptive
Alright, people should continue to chime in here, and if we don’t get a resolution already, let’s confirm it at the release weekly when we all meet.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.message: Also +1 to pushing this out by ~2-3 days. I anticipate a cherry-picking festival if we don’t, and it might risk making things worse if miss a pick or two in between.
Pushing a few days works for me, too!
looks like we’ve got a quorum; just let us know when we have a stable release date to plan around please :pray:
(stable > fast, especially since this is a big-seeming release)
want to tentatively pencil in Thurs so we have a date to announce to everyone?
Thurs 19 for code cut, and UAT start. eod tues 24 the following week for UAT end. Push to prod on Wed 25 morning to start 2 week bake. April 8 end of bake.
no need to pick a date now; unless you mean pick a date on Thursday
ah - i think this is a broader question now… i’ll see myself out :slightly_smiling_face:
